```{r}
library(tidyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r}

future_collection<-read_csv("all_commodities_futures_collection.csv")

#Summarise cases
spec(future_collection)

#count number of rows in each group defined by the variables in,... tally(), add_count(), add_tally()

count(future_collection)
```

```{r}
#group cases,use group by to create a grouped copy of table grouped columns in dplyr functions will manipulate each group separately and combine the results.

future_collection%>%
  group_by(category)%>%
  summarise(avg=mean(high))


#rowwise

future_collection%>%
  rowwise()%>%
  mutate(lean_hogs = length(animal_products))

```
